column4: it's physically too much time to invest.  it sucks too because all i have left to do is my video and my wireless(so i can tuck this machine in the closet).
how do i go from my desktop gui back to command line?
is there a quit or something:?
since i cant get the gui working i might as well just hit command line (which feels like a really lame reason to only use command line)
but terminal still means xserrver is running, no? i want to quit it.
do you know how to find and kill processes?
or maybe you need to do /etc/init.d gnome stop
maybe someone here can help you get the gui working
i wanted to shutdown the gui and go command line only (since my gui doesnt work right).  i figured it out though
but i guess my problem overall is my wireless does not work and my resolution on my screen is screwed.
quiting the gui isn't going to help your wireless
switching your resolution takes editing your xorg.conf file which takes a little time
ideogram:i know. but my res it messed up and it's driving me crazy.
but it's not hard once you know how
i found a modeline generator and configured it right from the manual of my monitor.  xorg crashed and wouldnt start gnome.
